oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Harlan Howard Written Song Recordings - Tape 6
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The series of recordings features a variety of tracks written by Harlan Howard. The tracks are performed by a variety of artists including: D. Deal, Jimmy Dickens, George Jones, Burl Ives, Brenda Lee, Waylon Jennings, Bobby Bare, and the Glaser Brothers (musical group). The tracks are from a variety of unidentified dates. The tape is the sixth in a series of eight.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Harlan Howard
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) You'll Get Used to Being Lonely (D. Deal) -- (02:14) Another Bridge to Burn (Jimmy Dickens) -- (05:08) Your Heart Turned Left (And I Was on the Right) (George Jones) -- (07:20) Something I Dreamed (George jones) -- (09:53) Unemployment Check (Burl Ives) -- (12:17) Too Many Rivers (Brenda Lee) -- (15:00) Watching the Fire Go Down (Jimmy Dickens) -- (17:31) Sing the Girls a Song (Waylon Jennings) -- (19:48) Streets of Baltimore (Bobby Bare) -- (22:23) Time to Bum Again (Waylon Jennings) -- (24:20) Baby, They're Playing Our Song (Glaser Brothers)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Deal, D.; Dickens, Little Jimmy, 1920-2015; Jennings, Waylon; Bare, Bobby; Glaser Brothers; Howard, Harlan; Jones, George, 1931-2013; Ives, Burl, 1909-1995; Lee, Brenda, 1944-;
